trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target:
\n

\ntrue to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the stream does not support seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target:
\n

An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the stream does not support seeking.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The next character from the underlying string, or -1 if no more characters are available.

\n
trans-unit.target:
\n

The next character from the underlying string, or -1 if no more characters are available.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
trans-unit.target:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The total number of characters read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target:
\n

The total number of characters read into the buffer.

trans-unit.source:
This can be less than the number of characters requested if that many characters are not currently available, or zero if the end of the underlying string has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target:
This can be less than the number of characters requested if that many characters are not currently available, or zero if the end of the underlying string has been reached.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.
trans-unit.target:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The position in buffer at which to begin writing.

\n
trans-unit.target:
\n

The position in buffer at which to begin writing.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.
trans-unit.target:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.

trans-unit.source:
If the end of the string is reached before the specified number of characters is written into the buffer, the method returns.

\n
trans-unit.target:
If the end of the string is reached before the specified number of characters is written into the buffer, the method returns.

\n

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.

trans-unit.source:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the string has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the string has been reached.

\n

The sum of index and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
